result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devontay L Jackson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devontay L Jackson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton appeared by video for Devontay L Jackson.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Martin.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devontay L Jackson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jaymes K. Fenton appeared for Devontay L Jackson.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas appeared for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for State v. Lee hearing.  Defense counsel has been appointed for the defendant.  Defense counsel is in trial on another matter and unavailable for today's proceedings.  Court scheduled a preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devontay L Jackson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for State v. Lee hearing.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan appointed as counsel for the defendant in error.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devontay L Jackson not in court, in custody in MSDF.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Devontay L Jackson not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with MVF; SLG; BDK; FMM; RWN; NKP; TPW; and Treveonta Davis-Spears (co-actor)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered co-defs kept separate while in custody.

Defendant Devontay L Jackson in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Devontay L Jackson in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Devontay L Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed due to co-defendant's lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
